summary: An internal email from a warden to all staff at a correctional facility, likely the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, sent on August 12, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death. The message reminds staff of policies and protocols, emphasizes doing the right thing, and designates only the Public Information Officer to speak with media, reflecting heightened scrutiny following Epstein's death.

keyFacts: The document is an internal staff email sent on August 12, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The warden emphasizes following protocols like '30 minute irregular rounds' and 'detailed counts', which are relevant to inmate supervision and suicide prevention.
The message restricts media communication to only the designated Public Information Officer, indicating heightened media attention and a controlled response.
The email references 'things happening around our agency that does not highlight the great work we do', likely alluding to the fallout and scrutiny following Epstein's death.
